paper_metadata.title: Impact of Regional Innovation Policy on Energy Poverty Alleviation in China: Evidence from Double Machine Learning and Spatial Difference-in-Difference

program_information.program_name: New Policy for Innovative Transformation in Regional Industrial Chains
program_information.target_population: Residents in regions with energy poverty

study_characteristics.outcomes_evidence_citation: This study employs double machine learning and spatial difference-in-difference for causal inference to explore the impact of a medium-to long-term regional innovation pilot policy in China—the new policy for innovative transformation in regional industrial chains—on energy poverty alleviation
study_characteristics.design_evidence_citation: Based on panel data from 30 provinces (except Tibet) in mainland China from 2009 to 2021, this study employs double machine learning and spatial difference-in-difference for causal inference

evidence_citations.program_name_citation: This study employs double machine learning and spatial difference-in-difference for causal inference to explore the impact of a medium-to long-term regional innovation pilot policy in China—the new policy for innovative transformation in regional industrial chains
evidence_citations.country_citation: Based on panel data from 30 provinces (except Tibet) in mainland China from 2009 to 2021
evidence_citations.target_population_citation: not only has China faced the contradiction between its huge population size and per capita energy scarcity for a long time, but the rigid constraints brought by energy poverty have also plagued the lives and production of Chinese residents
